message_1: What is the major product formed when 1-methylcyclohexene undergoes hydrogenation in the presence of a palladium catalyst?
message_2: When 1-methylcyclohexene undergoes hydrogenation in the presence of a palladium catalyst, the major product formed is methylcyclohexane. This reaction involves the addition of hydrogen (H2) across the carbon-carbon double bond, converting the alkene (1-methylcyclohexene) into an alkane (methylcyclohexane).
